page.title: 06Ancillary worker interview.
page.content: This lady,in her early thirties,lives in the village. She works part time in the infant department of the{private} {school.}She is,therefore, glad that the private school is in the village as it provides{employment}and adds to the trade in the{village shop;}she would find it inconvenient if the shop were to close. She lives on one of the new estates in the village and finds the long established families rather suspicious of newcomers, taking a very long time to accept them. She likes the quiet{village life}with its reasonable playing field, proximity to good leisure facilities and twice yearly sale of 2nd-hand childrens clothes. She's disappointed in the lack of a playgroup,the vandalism,the necessity of a car and nosiness of the villagers
